elements.data: For all Detroit youth to have access to music, art, creative writing, and coding enrichment opportunities.
Providing music, arts, creative writing, and coding enrichment for Detroit youth through meaningful relationships between teachers, students, and community partners.
Opportunity — Providing Detroit students with extracurricular experiences that inspire and enrich creative thought.
Education — Teaching concrete music, art, and computer science skills with the aid of both volunteers and professional educators.
Service — Helping our partners achieve their development goals through a mutual relationship of respect and understanding.
Community — Fostering civic solidarity by connecting University of Michigan students with our greater Detroit community.

Seven Mile first began as a music education program during the 2013-2014 school year at the University of Michigan. Sam Saunders, a Piano major and alumnus of the School of Music, Theatre and Dance, founded Seven Mile Music in direct response to the harsh cuts to music and arts education funding in Detroit Public Schools. Based on a belief that every student should have access to music education, Seven Mile understands that the opportunity to creatively express oneself is essential for all children and has since expanded to teach art, creative writing, and coding.
